locutie.beschrijving: The sermon addresses the suffering and commitment of the Montgomery community in light of the Passion and Resurrection. It links their local 'Calvary' to the cosmic victory of Christ.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Theological and typological. It uses the Passion narrative as a lens for current civil rights struggles rather than a verse-by-verse exposition.

illocutie.beschrijving: The preacher moves from describing the impact of the movement (Assertive) to encouraging the weary (Expressive) and finally grounding their hope in God's victory (Commissive).
voorbeelden: God will not leave our souls in hell

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: Fortitude, hope, and a sense of divine vindication amidst social suffering.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Implicit; the 'whispers of God' and 'soul searching' suggest the Spirit's internal work.

voorbeelden: The central drama of the Christian faith is the death of our Lord
Montgomery has become a central item on the prayer agenda
He will perform it until the day of Jesus Christ
We shall also be in the likeness of his resurrection
commissieven.kwaliteit: Strongly grounded in the character of God and the historical Resurrection.

declaratieven.autoriteit: High; the preacher acts as a communal representative 'staking' the collective life on a promise.

indicatoren: The coming forth of the reigning Lord represents for Christians...
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Provides a necessary theological framework for the struggle.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: Highly specific to the context of the Montgomery struggle.
voorbeelden: God will not leave our souls in hell
He which hath begun a good work in you will perform it

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address to the suffering community ('your Calvary', 'you and I').
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used to apply the promise of the resurrection to their specific pain.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing the 'world', 'men and women', and 'the Lord'.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Minimal; used to show the cosmic scale of their local actions.

verleden_tijd.gebruik: The events of Good Friday and the start of the movement.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: Theological definitions of Resurrection and God's nature.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (Resurrection facts) -> Commissive (God will perform it) -> Directive (Take heart).
voorbeelden: Christians believe... (Assertive) -> He will perform it (Commissive) -> Take heart (Directive)
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: Excellent; the imperatives are entirely sustained by the divine indicatives.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: As surely as God lives... Take heart then

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon functions as a 'word-event' that reinterprets the hearers' suffering as a participation in the life of Christ, effectively 'creating' hope.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: He which hath begun a good work in you will perform it
sterke_punten.effect: Binds God's faithfulness to the people's survival.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The coming forth of the reigning Lord represents for Christians the denial of all the charges...

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It transforms the identity of the Montgomery protesters from victims to participants in a divine drama.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The use of 'Your Calvary' functions as a linguistic bridge that makes the grace of the cross present in the 1950s.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Yes, through the quoted promise of Philippians.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Yes, the preacher stakes the faith of the community on God's character.
tekstueel_bewijs: As surely as God lives, his way must triumph

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: The preacher leaves the 'denouement' and 'triumph' to God's providence.
tekstueel_bewijs: things of which you and I do not dream are taking place through God's providence

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Yes, it offers 'peace some day' as a tangible gift.
sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: Highly epiphanic; uses light/dark and death/resurrection imagery.
tekstueel_bewijs: the trumpets at the end of the drama are no longer muted

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is well-balanced but relies heavily on the future tense for its performative power.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: Christians believe that the resurrection... was the reversal
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: In the resurrection, God reverses the verdict against you today.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from a general Christian tenet to a present-tense declarative act.

toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Maintain the use of Scripture as the primary vehicle for the Commissive.
voorbeeldzinnen: God promises you today: He will perform the work He started.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: The balance is a model for homiletical structure.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon successfully avoids the 'constative surplus' by tethering every historical and theological fact to the immediate, lived reality of the congregation through powerful commissive acts.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: Unlike SvT, which would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' or 'appeal', SAT reveals that the preacher is actually performing a divine covenantal act.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: It is not merely persuasive; it is 'staking' reality on a promise, which is an ontological rather than just a psychological move.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT highlights that the 'Toezegging' (Philippians 1:6) is the engine of the sermon, not just a concluding quote.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: He which hath begun a good work in you will perform it
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: Maximum; it shifts the burden from the hearer to God.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses 'Your Calvary' as a performative metaphor that collapses the time-gap between the biblical text and the Montgomery context.
